newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: BTA shares oversubscribed in selloff.
newsitem.headline: BTA shares oversubscribed in selloff.

text.p: Shares in the public offer to sell (OPV) in the privatisation of Portuguese bank Banco Totta e Acores were comfortably oversubscribed on the eve of Wednesday's deadline for applications, an official source in the bank said yesterday.
"Based on figures from (Monday), demand for shares is more than double the available supply of 1.6 million shares," the source told Reuters.
The source had no information about the domestic and international direct sale of more than 6.3 million shares in Totta.
Today is the last day for the submission of applications for shares.

A special session will be held at Lisbon bourse on November 19 to announce the results of the sale of a 13.22 percent stake in Totta held by the government, amounting to 7,929,471 shares. The new Totta shares will be introduced to Lisbon bourse the following day.
